CatDescriptText: Nancy Walker, secretary, McKeesport, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike?  Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" answer reads: "Yes, I do, because I am of the opinion that management of the steel mills will grant no more concessions.  I think that possibly a request for a wage increase is justified."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Nancy Walker wearing eyeglasses and trench coat, holding light colored gloves in right hand, standing in front of Sherwin Williams store window with paint displays, including one which reads "Just Say 'Charge It' We'll Open Your Account Today", possibly Smithfield Street, Downtown
